dmca.title: Copyright/GPL Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Help Center Live - Mike [mailto:mike@helpcenterlive.com] 
Sent: Monday, January 03, 2005 10:32 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Copyright/GPL Infringement

Hi,

My name is Michael Bird and I am the author of a piece of Live Support 
software called 'Help Center Live' http://www.helpcenterlive.com 
distributed under the GPL license.

One of the users of my software informed me of a website 
http://www.markettalker.com that is claiming my software as their own. 
Even though I cannot see the source code, I know how my code works and 
what the user interface feels like. As well as the obvious similarities 
in design (only the colours have changed) the layout and 
functionalities of the software and the administration panel are 
completely the same. No download link for source code was provided on 
the website (I used a translator as the site is in Portuguese) which is 
against the GPL license.

I do not mind them distributing a Portugese version of my software as 
long as it complies with the GPL license. The copyright notices need to 
be changed back and a download link of the entire source code provided 
along with the GPL license, as well as a GPL license header, and my 
copyright in each of the source code files.

I have contacted them about the issues and the person I was speaking to 
played ignorant with me. After trying to sort this out in a civilized 
manner with them, I did a lookup on the domain and it pointed to one of 
your servers http://www.whois.sc/markettalker.com. Legal action is not 
a preferable option for me as the code is GPL, and therefore 
distributed free of charge, however I will take it as a last resort.

I hope you will be able to help me with this matter as the people at 
http://www.markettalker.com are not being co-operative.

Thanks for your time,
Mike
